Creativity, gorgeous art design, and a phenomenal musical score are what await you in Monument Valley 2 The improvements from the first title are truly astonishing. I never felt as though the first grassped the full potential of its concept. But Monument Valley 2 takes the fantastic foundation laid by the first game, and builds a skyscraper with it Everything from the Art, Level Design, Color contrast, buitiful music, ect. just makes for a game that is a pure bliss to experience. 10/10

Answer this: I'm a 6' 2" 220 lb 55 year-old man - how is THIS my favorite game? I play war games and flight simulators, not mothers instilling daughters with blatant disregard for 3 dimensional geometry! And those crows... so irritating! Yet I am drawn in again and again by the peaceful suspense of its soft impossibilities and gentle bending of my mind. My eyes and ears are friends once again and thank me for this rare treat. And now I know Ro, and I know her daughter. Good people, they.

Highly recommended sequel to a brilliant first game.

Monument Valley 2 is presented in an isometric view. The goal is to guide Ro and her child through mazes that include elements of optical illusions and impossible objects. The player can tap on the screen to move either Ro or her child (depending on the chapter) or to trigger changes in the architecture of the level to complete the puzzle.

I loved at and I first saw this in Play store and Google. I may still love the first Monument Valley game but I love the sequel as well. When I first saw the app, I used thought the little girl wearing a red hood was actually Ida in a new outfit with her elder friend until I read about Monument Valley 2 in google that the elder was actually Ro and the little girl is her daughter but nameless. How about we name her Rona in honor of her mother but let her remain nameless. Every scene in this game about Ro and her daughter hugging together always puts a smile on my face. I even discovered new things there like new ghosts ( there are more than one ghosts in the sequel unlike the first and they are Ro and her daughter's ancestors ), a new totem ( whose name is Doortem ), new and better sound effects, music, and graphics, and a new sacred geometry in which you need to make on your own. I think Monument Valley 2 must have two expansions like the first game. You think ustwo games ? From a story perspective, the game doesn't quite match the original's storytelling, however the journey of a mother and a daughter is still very compelling. Gameplay and puzzle solving isn't as difficult as the first game as well, but once again retains my attention with its beautiful environments. Amazing game, great buy!

Absolutely love those game. Just as with the first version, this game is

play store. Stop your whining.

An absolutely riveting game - full of gorgeous colour palletes, engaging 
visuals and delightfully enchanting game mechanics. Amazingly, the story in 
this sequel is even better than the original. Heartfelt and surprisingly 
moving for its aesthetic simplicity and minimalism. No device is complete 
without this perfect game.

Total Masterpiece. A masterpiece of design, a masterpiece for the 
atmosphere, music, colors and more than all a completely inspired level 
design. It's just genius, the perfect evolution from the 1st episode. Well 
worth all the money spent. Never too difficult, never frustrating. Probably 
still little bit too easy and short but it also gave the player some of the 
best touching moments ever saw in a videogame. When the 3rd episode is 
coming out? When are more levels going to be available?

After playing the first installment I HAD to buy this however there is A 
LOT of similarity, especially in the first half of the game...it's also a 
little too easy IMHO...could do with raising the difficulty slightly. I 
completed this game more quickly than I'd have hoped with only a couple of 
levels (later on in the game) that actually made me scratch my head. That 
being said, the gameplay is thoroughly addictive and the developers should 
be VERY proud of this concept, it keeps you enthralled as there is never a 
direct way to complete each level, thought is required. All in all 5+ stars 
- I will definitely buy the next instalment!

If you LOVED the first MV, you'll "like" MV2. I love the game play, 
graphics (visually stunning, again!), sound, and creativity. So, you may 
ask, why only 3 stars? After the first mind-bending game, this sequel was, 
well, "meh"... too easy and too short. I expected a game that would 
challenge me like the first one did, but once you understand the basic 
physics, now every level is just too simple. It's enjoyable, but for a paid 
app, I expected more than 2 more hours of game play. Oh well, I'll 
anxiously wait for a MV3, but it'd better WOW me, or I'm done.

The game is disappointing. Visually it's stunning, the colors and textures 
are,indeed, gorgeous, but the puzzles are very lacking. There is nothing 
like the toy box from the first game. Nothing to truly sink your teeth 
into. It feels more like a walking simulator than anything else, but those 
have a strong story to rely on, which this game also lacks. What is more, 
every time they try a new puzzle approach, instead of building on it they 
quickly abandon it for the next. And finally, I didn't buy this game for 
someone's postmodern art attempts. Please, no more of that.

I find this game absolutely brilliant! The music is fantastic and the 
graphics are beautiful and that creates a wonderful, deep atmosphere. The 
gameplay with the optical illusions in it is very creative and fun. It's a 
great addition to the first game. It just explores the universe of the 
first game a little deeper. For those who have not played the first game, I 
would recommend to play that before you play this, simply because it keeps 
on exploring new possibilities and if you play it backwards you'll find 
yourself doing things you'd already done in a more complicated way. By 
that, however, I don't mean to say that the first one is not as interesting 
as this one.

shame really

Astonishingly gorgeous in every way, shape and form: the story, the music, the sound effects, and the art. I can't think of another game that even comes close too such a perfectly cohesive aesthetic.  Add to that the mind exercising game play that somehow manages to be both simple and challenging at the same time (though I did find it easier than MV1,I think mostly because I how to think about the problems this time).  Some nice new puzzle types, my favorite being the trees that grow and shrink with light exposure. And the story? Wow! How can anyone make a few pixels walk in such a way that you know almost precisely the age of the daughter, and her relationship with the mother? Just stunning!

The most beautiful mobile game I have ever played. The first one was gorgeous as well, but this sequel is a spectacular visual treat.  With that being said, this game is disappointingly short.  The first game was too short as well, and the expansion should have been included.  I would love to play more of this game, but I'm really not looking forward to shelling out for another full game, just for a few more levels.  The other criticism I have, which mirrors other reviews, is that the first half is nothing more than a duplicate of the first game, mechanically.  The visuals are amazing, but that can only carry you so far.  I would love to see new mechanics and a bigger challenge, as the final levels are no harder than the first, there doesn't seem to be any progression of challenge.  I would rate 5 stars, but the length drops it to 4.  The lack of originality and challenge drop it to 3.  If the devs give us a good expansion, and that expansion isn't greedy, I might reconsider my score.

Freaking Mind Blowing. No other puzzle game can compare to this work of art, wayyy too much work has gone into this to not be thoroughly appreciated and enjoyed. Relaxing, mentally involving, visually astounding, - all words that describe this game.
Levelnya terlalu sedikit. Tamat hanya dlm 1 hari. Utk harga segini terlalu mahal
Pretty much what I expected. Great game with stunning visuals.
Great game. But I beat it in less than an hour....

Be Amazed and Dissapointed! The gameplay is beautifully done, even better than the first version.  It is one of the best games I have ever seen.   However, the game is simply too easy and too short.  I did the whole thing in about 2 hours.  I am really hoping they release some more levels shortly.
Incredibly short, and with much less challenge than the first one.
The graphics were great! And I also liked the tree. :) Maybe next time you could throw in a few more levels and make it a little longer? But otherwise keep up the great work!
Great game! Thanks

Puzzles weren't as intense as the first Monument Valley game but i guess this version is more about a story than solving 3D puzzles. Overall it had really good music that made me pause my regular music while playing this game. It's graphically stunning and looks great on any phablet.

Loved the monument valley series. The second one is as beautiful as the first one. It just not as challenging. But it was compensate with the beautiful and warm story of Ro and her cute child. Love it. It feels that due to the easy challenge and the theme of the story (motherhood/parent/ etc) monument valley 2 is a more suited game as an introduction to the series for little kid (my lil niece is having a tough time on the first game. But I'm sure she can go past through this game easily)  Looking forward for the next installment. Hope it's has better stories and lot more challenging puzzles. Thanks for the great game. Keep creating.   Cheers HK

I almost never cry, but playing this I cried like a baby. Very beautiful game with excellent music and artwork (reminds me of a "duo": Mr. Bill and Funilab). Maybe you'd like to get some additional inspiration. Best wishes!

A lot of people demanded mv sequel,  which annoyed me.  I thought: why do you people need sequels for everything?   Personally, i never wanted a sequel;  in fact I HATE sequels in general,  i find them useless and annoying.  But love this one;  the devs went and made it a great new game;  it has every bit as much heart and soul as the first one It's not better than MV but it is just as good. Every bit as creative!  MV has a better story,  more thought-provoking.  Story here is more simple but it works as exploring/wandering/learning theme and there are delightful surprises along the way. I'm very story-oriented so i look for stories that touch my heart to go with good visuals-mv2 ticks all the boxes and is one of the games I refuse to uninstall! . The mazes are gorgeous,  beautiful settings/worlds and difficulty for them seems fine. I LOVE the orchard! It's fantastic!   I slightly more prefer the story in mv but i do like the journey here as well,  it's a lovely mother-daughter journey with wonders along the way.   I love monument valley! These are games made with love. Make a new game now,  though.
Wonderful! I very much enjoyed getting to play an extension of the original game I loved so much, and you can see all the time and love put into it.

Problem solving games are my go to game and this game is exactly what I was looking for.

I want my money back!!  Huge disappointment!  Part one was complicated enough that it kept me interested and playing for days!  Part two, my cat could solve the puzzles!  The only reason I went to the end of this game was thinking surely there has to be a mind blowing puzzle that would keep me stumped for days!  Once I reached the end I sighed in complete disappointment. But wait I thought!  Maybe there's more.  Maybe there will be the greatest puzzle ever waiting after the credits!  As I searched through the menus, I couldn't find it!  My disappointment sent me in such a slouch in my seat that my hands let go of the phone and dropped on my sleeping cat who became startled and began scratching and bitting me!  Now I'm bleeding.  Like I said, I want my money back!

Its beautiful. The journey was amazing. But it is too short for such price. And the game now more like walking simulator - you need just relax and enjoy the amazing scenery. Very few actual challenges for the brain. The focus shifted from puzzles to narrative.  So, bottomline: Its expensive, short, 'tap to walkthrough' for the most part, very few new concepts and mechanics, BUT it's still beautiful, with gorgeous music and setting, AND the only real change is having more story in gameplay. I want more. But please more challenge, more originality and more Totem. Can we expect to wait for the next addon with all this  stuff?

I loved the original game and its expansion pack, Forgotten Shores, so much that I got this despite the misgivings of some of the reviews. While FS was only ¬£2.99, it has just 8 levels, whereas this has 14. I was not disappointed, quite the opposite, but my expectations may have been lowered by the reviews. If anything it's even more stunningly beautiful & enchanting than the original. Perhaps there isn't much new in the gameplay, but MV was such an innovative puzzle game in the first place, I found this just as entertaining and engrossing. Its appeal is, as much as anything, in its aesthetics: it's an experience as much as a game, its music, graphics & narrative all blending perfectly to create a mood. Full of little touches like the Mondrian reference (very witty, given the game's Escheresque world) in one level. The only game that's close to being as original & beautifully executed is an old PS2 game called Herdy Gerdy, which seems to have had quite a niche following (a puzzle game that involved herding different animals into various pens with Disney quality animation. It sounds like a dull idea, but was funny, entertaining, gorgeous & fiendishly challenging). Anyway, I would, & will heartily recommended Monument Valley 2.

MV I, Forgotten Shores, and Ida's Dream are real tough acts to follow.  In MV II I missed the surprises, the foreshadowing, and the almost but not quite comprehensible story.  If I started out with Monument Valley 2, I'd probably give it all max scores, so this is hard.  Sadly, I find I'm disappointed because it isn't nearly as challenging, and the game play is too slow.  The animations are beautiful, but they really slow things down.  On a brighter note, playing this game motivated me to reinstall all of the others and play them again--they are as immerse and addictive as ever, and I've enjoyed several hours revisiting that world.  Playing the old games even helped me enjoy this one a bit more, but it made the difference more apparent.  It's probably unfair to ask for another dose of the old magic, but I will anyway.  I'm sure these two, US Two, can do it.  Please.

I have no idea why this game is getting such a bad rep, it's great. It does everything a good sequel should do, up the stakes with new types of puzzles, shows more of world and expands the plot and characters, and stays true to the original. I even liked the visuals much more in this one, it's heartbreakingly beautiful, you can see the love and care put into each one of these levels. The only negatve I can put out there is that it's a little too easy in some parts but I believe that was in response to how difficult to the point of annoyance the last game was. Difficulty is a hard thing to balance, especially in a puzzle, and given how good the rest of the game was I'll be happy to give it a pass. My only other complaint was how short the game was. That may be valid but it is also indicative of how good the game was, since I was left wanting more. All in all it was a great experience and I'm happy to recommend it to anyone who was happy with the first one.

I can't give MV2 anything less than 5 stars because it is still one of the best games I've ever played. It would only lose a star in comparison with its superior predecessor. I loved the new puzzle types, especially the light puzzles. I, too, thought it was too short and the puzzles were easier than I remember from the first game. My main complaint, however, is that the narrative was not nearly as evocative as the first. The growing of a child is a sweet story, but the narrative in the first game was a journey of grief, guilt, and forgiveness, a much more complex story. The emotions it evoked were real, whereas MV2 evoked only recognition of the symbolism: I too am a parent and this journey is like my journey!  Still, this game is fantastic on all merits. I look forward to a more emotional story again in the next installment. Devs, creative team, you're doing a fantastic job. I'll buy every new story you make.

Honestly, it's a delightful little game but I can't help feeling somewhat underwhelmed. The first game was short, but it had enough depth and challenge to make repeated plays worthwhile. This sequel had some great new ideas, but the story was much less intriguing, and it was all too easy. Even the last level, which was a little more challenging than the rest, was nowhere near as complex as some of the levels in the first game. So while still a lovely experience, it felt far less satisfying than the original. Still worth getting and playing through once or twice, but I really hope the developers add more levels to this in the future - I'd happily pay for an expansion if it added more depth and challenge to the overall experience. Still, a great game in itself and worth the money - I just felt like there should have been more to it.

This game deserved a 5 star similar to its previous version. Many people think that the gameplay was too short and the puzzles were too easy. However, people simply ignore a far greater lesson in this game, a story about a fretting mother that had to go through, worrying her child growing up in this world. This reflect us back in real life that our mother took care of us when we're small and it's our turn to look after them when they're old. I must said that my money are well spend on this game. Beautiful art, storyline and background music that never seen before. Kudos to the developer and wishing them all the best for future of Monument Valley.

As a work of art and design, it's absolutely gorgeous and brilliant. As a puzzle, it's not nearly as challenging as the first   Monument Valley. I think the designers forgot it was a puzzle game. Also, there's no indication ahead of time of how many levels there are, which unnecessarily adds to the disappointing sense that it's too short when the last level is surprisingly done. All this did not prevent me from playing through twice, though.   If you have not played the first Monument Valley, I highly recommend starting with this shorter and less challenging edition, and then getting the first one. Fans of the first one will not want to miss this new edition, so I recommend it, as long as you are forewarned that it's beautiful and imaginative, but shorter and less challenging as a puzzle.

Great sequel! Love the story and graphic. Really live up to the 1st one. The difficulty is kinda easy not much challenging. Some chaptors are so well design. Hope fully there'll more to this story.
Oh my goodness! This game is so amazing I can't wait to dive into the DLC (if there is going to be any)

MV1 was a superb game, brilliantly realised. This sequel I had great expectations of but was a little disappointed. Some levels were rather short, one or two exceptionally so. There were some new ideas, again well done but in essence it was like an expansion pack. There did not seem to be the complexity of before and often a level was a one trick wonder, repeated, with little of the creativity and cleverness of design I was hoping for. Still worth playing but it is always hard to live up to something as good as MV1.
A most beautiful game visually stunning and a 3d view that will bend your brain to push back into 2 dimensions

I bought this game today and finished it. I was hooked on the first one and was hooked with this one. The graphics are stunning and beautiful. This was a little bit of a challenge as I had to think logically with some of the moves. It took me a while to figure it out but eventually got them. It was well worth the money I spent. I will play this one over and over again. Absolutely loved it.
I felt like the puzzles we're too easy. Maybe it's for kids... Not worth $5 imo for the hour I got out of it
Great job as always. Gorgeous game. Relaxing puzzler w great music. Hope we don't have to wait as long for a third installment or get more levels.
Like its predecessor, one of the most beautiful, serene games I have ever played.
The game is just beautiful
Even better than the first game and still absolutely lovely for all the same reasons. Also more touching imho
Well designed in both music and visuals. Cute story but it was too short and simple. I think the first one of the series had more puzzles which were more complex as well.
Great gameplay like the original Monument Valley, but very short and simple especially for the price.
Amazing sequel one of the best games across mobile, plain and simple.

I absolutely loved it. I'm not usually the kind of guy who plays phone games often but this stunned me. I played the first one right before this one and they are by far the best phone games I've played to date. I love the music so much and the perception puzzles. I really loved it guys, when's the third one coming outüòâüëç

Good but... more of the same and completed it too quickly. I appreciate they are probably hugely difficult games to make and what they do, they do well. Ultimately didn't require much thought though.

I loved Monument Valley 1 and was thrilled to find # 2. Sadly, though the graphics are still fantastic, I feel that the puzzles left much to be desired. Just not challenging, or multi-dimensional which is exactly what I loved about the first. Beautiful game and amazing concepts, just not very exciting.
Absolutely gorgeous. I was utterly transported into a beautiful new world. Great puzzles - easily as great as the first!

I loved the first one, but this one was too short, and not as challenging as the first one. I finished it in a few hours. Graphics, music are as beautiful as the first but hopefully they release and update with more [free] levels. Was not worth the $4.99. Maybe $2.99? Big fan on the series, just things to consider.
Beautiful and fun.

Not worth the wait or price. Very little game play and difficulty is set to dumb. Puzzles are not challenging and the game feels like it's playing itself while you just pull a few levers. The 2 character play diminishes the connection with the main player. The only thing that saves it from a total disappointment is the immersive world and music yet even there the original outshines the sequel.
Definitely easier but by now the MV gameplay isn't a mystery. Still nice. Replaying the original probably more rewarding.
A cute continuation of the prequel. Relaxing and atmospheric. But nothing ground breaking compared to the first.
This game was very fun and I also loved the story

The phenomenon returns! MV2 is a fantastic sequel to its mind-blowing predecessor, and boy oh boy did the developers try their best to make an even more fascinating and heart-warming game. I bought it right after it came out on Android, in my case the wait actually built up my excitement even more! Totally worth a purchase and a must-have title for anyone who likes a lovely story with deep message for the player. Excellent work, and a big thank you to ustwo games! ‚ù§Ô∏è
Best kind of mobile game. Ustwo has done it again! I didn't even know there was a second game out until 2 days ago. It was just as classy as the first one if a little bit shorter feeling. Great game
Not up to the mark difficulty level wise
Really quite superb. A definite for anyone who enjoyed the first version. Worth the money without a doubt.
Well, the game is much easier than the original but makes up with even more stunning visuals and even better soundtrack that its predecessor. 10/10, 420 blazeit
Way way too easy and too short. No challenge at all. Should be free at this level of simplicity and short duration of game play.

Just installed it and finished within 3 hours while eating and watching movies. I'm quite disappointed with the gameplay. I was hoping to get challenging levels something like level 8 from the Forgotten Shore from MV1. Waste of time and money.
Beautiful, but too short and too easy
Great game again, but way too short. It couldn't have taken me more than 1-1.5 hours to finish... I don't feel like I got my $5 worth on this one.
When you thought it was the best you can have, it just went better.
Beautiful inside and out. Tells such a deep, feminist-minded story in its little world of impossible puzzles and ethereal music.

As much as I love the game. It's far too short for what you pay. I got it free with rewards I had saved but it seems like a waste. Finished it in the first day. The game itself is incredible. I love everything about it except the length. Will there be more coming to it?

This game is excellent on so many levels...the story, graphics, game play, music and more.  The downfall is that it's not long enough.  The story is heartfelt and really had an impact, you do not find that it in very many games. The sequel took too long to come out but it was worth the wait.
Another great Monument Valley, not as great as the 1st one, but still awesome. Only criticism, way too short for the amount of money asked.
Best cell phone game series ever!
Lives up to MV, but does not surpass it.

Awesome game the game is awesome I like it very much but the levels are very easy then the previous one so make the levels hard on next time, and the controls and music were very very good and awesome

Way too easy and too short! Graphics are nice, but there are no false clues, not even a chance to get stuck. A skip button for those animations at the end of the levels would be nice to have.

Play time is way too short

Played on a Galaxy Note 8 running 7.1.1 and works with the S PenüñãÔ∏è, The 1st version had more of a challenge and was longer. This 2nd version is way to short and simple=ZERO challenge. It's almost like they ran out of ideas, but needed to cash in on previous fame=for shame! How about an upgrade pack down the road with additional levels that are more challenging for free since $4.99 is to much for being so short with no challenge unless you're mentally impaired! This is worth $1.99 at best! The first Monument Valley was your A game, a master piece and now it's a C+ posser! It reminds me of a blockbuster original movie and they make a crappy sequel just to cash in on the original's success. Monument Valley 2 is that crappy sequel! I know you guys have great ingenuity because of your first offering. "The Room" puzzle game is an excellent example of ingenuity building on success to take sequels to a whole new level further showcasing the true talent of a game maker. Each of their sequels completely took their previous offering to a new level of puzzle solving and an in depth storyline. You guys need that outside the box thinking mentality back that created Monument Valley 1, for now I've lost that lovin feeling I had for you guys...
I so like this better than the first one. I love this game so much and I was waiting for a second one, and it passed my expectations. I hope there's a 3rd one and even more.
While as mesmerizingly beautiful as the original, it's not nearly as challenging, which in the end is a big deal and renders the game NOT worth $4.99. Too bad.
As others have stated, the game is beautiful and is a welcome sequel to the first game, but for $5 it is too short and not challenging enough.  MV1 provided both of these. I'm a bit disappointed.
Great game, but at a little bit under 1.5 hours to complete the whole game I find it a bit too short. Graphics are amazing though and the gameplay is just as good as the original.
Awesome!

Good

The puzzles are simple, but the beautiful graphics and story line made up for it, to me.  This game is in my top favorites, if not thee top favorite game of mine to play. A fun visual and auditory experience. A bit short, but worth the money. This game is more immersive than the original with the exception of the segment transitions, which seem lazier, especially surrounding how totem buddies end up in the next segment. Overall, buy it, play it - worth it.

good graphics

Love the game and it's worth the price, but the game doesn't support 18:9 screens. The developers are iOS first mindset, I think. I emailed ustwo, and they replied that they're working on an update, but this is a game with little replay value. I'm paying $5 for a single experience. It won't help at this point. Still a great game, which is why I'm still giving 5 stars, but I'm annoyed that after waiting for half a year after iOS release for this game to finally release on the phones that most people have, Android, it's not even optimized for current Android devices.   Edit: I ended up waiting to play for a while, and now the update for 18:9 is fantastic. Looking forward to seeing the end of the game! Thanks for the update!

A masterpiece of art, being solid for an infinitesimal fraction of its worth. I wish this was what we hung in our museums and galleries... It's a fun, well thought out hanger and the graphics are stunning. I don't believe it was as challenging as MV1. While it's worth paying for the game, I don't believe it's worth the $4.99 price tag. Not worth the money. Wow... The gameplay is so easy and not challenging at all. The levels are way shorter and simpler than the first version of this game. The first version of the game had a lot more brain-twisting areas and challenges, this second installment felt a lot like there wasn't a lot of effort put into it. I'm pretty upset I spent 5 dollars on it. It only took me 45 minutes to play through everything, and it REALLY didn't live up to the complexity and enjoyment of the first Monument Valley.

My suggestion if you are new to Monument Valley games: Start with number 2. THEN play the first. I loved the first MV game and waited with anticipation for a long time for this to hit android but after completing it in like 5 minutes (that's an exaggeration, but you get the idea) it left me disappointed. Was it a bad game? No, not at all but there was no challenge which took a bit of fun out of the game. Wish I could give a great review. The game still looked good. The sound track was good but there wasn't much that made it it's own game. I will still wait for a 3rd game in this series but I hope there will be puzzling aspects to THAT puzzle game.
It was too short. Not worth  $4.99.

I don't even know what to say. I had to play it multiple times through before I could even think of a review for it. To start, the characters are phenomenal. They have no faces, yet they show deep emotion. They have no mouths, yet they somehow still speak. Hough the character models are simple, you did an amazing job of conveying emotion and expression throuh movement and gestures. Next, gameplay was confounding. Every good gameplay aspect from MV1 was brought back into this one, along with original concepts and mesmerising images. Impossible yet beautiful. Finally, the music and soundtrack was like the finishing touch. It brought peace and serenity without repetition or annoying synth beats. I have loved MV since the beginning, and got the DLC for the first one. Checked the play store for 3 months straight, waiting for the release of this. So glad to finally have it. Thank you so much for all of this. :D

I thank you ever so much and am ever so grateful about this!üòÅ   Another great thing about this game is that it is a mix of unhappy times as well as happy moments!!! Everything is fantastic about what you have made and the idea of two characters - a child and young adult - is sooo much of a thoughtful thought!  I have a spark inside me that if you get as popular as with the other app you created, people may even ask you to bring a 'Monument Valley III (3)' out!  Thanks for what you have done.
Such a fantastic game.

I am horrifically disappointed in this sequel. There were only two levels in the entire game that provided any kind of decent challenge. And the innovations from those levels were used once and then discarded for the rest of the game. A huge amount of focus was put on the story of this one, and the only time I felt drawn in was when they brought back the doortem. The story ended nicely, but I felt completely empty and unfulfilled. There was such an incredible amount of potential here and it was all squandered.

I understand that you want your game to be enjoyed by everyone and have them see the story through but to me it was hard to finish, it's not engaging, there was little challenge to keep you wanting more. Also, the game is way too short. Gonna pass on dlcs. Hope more people rate this game the way it should be rated and not because they had so much fun on the first one.

As a fan of the first Monument Valley with the add on expansion pack (basically two games), I waited eagerly for this sequel. However, I was very disappointed in the puzzles of this sequel. The original game had great puzzles that you really had to work hard & put a lot of thought into to solve. This sequel's puzzles are easy and simple. I miss the crows that blocked the routes.  The art work is top notch and the music is not quite up to the original's standard. Worth maybe $1.99, but not the $4.99 it is here. I feel slightly cheated.  ~~~~"Ghosts of Memories"~~~~  For a better experience, longer game play and difficult puzzles, try "Ghosts of Memories". It is a haunting, thinking puzzle game I found after playing the original MV. "Ghosts of Memories" is hands down a better game by far over MV2. (As I write this, "Ghosts of Memories" is currently on sale for 99¬¢. It is worth it! )

Disappointed. I was very excited to play this game and it looks great and plays really well but the puzzles just aren't very challenging. The first one was amazing and I thought this would be a step up but it isn't.

The good things in life are worth waiting for. Finally, here are 14 new levels of one of the most beautiful, atmospheric games ever produced. In both sound and vision, Monument Valley 2 is a joy to behold.  Some people, however, are never satisfied; witness the many complaints that the game is over in less than an hour. What these players are failing to appreciate is that MV2 is an experience to be savoured, not to be ticked off a list. It's like a good meal, sex or fine company: the pleasure is in the experience itself, not reaching the end of it.  Take your time, absorb the minute audio-visual details, and take away a lasting memory. Who knows? Maybe more levels are coming.  Here's hoping for a Monument Valley 3.
One of the most imaginative games ever written in my opinion.  I love it!

This sequel makes subtle improvements on its predecessor, but the Escher-esque gameplay is not quite as striking the second time around. The story is more coherent but less original than the first. Nonetheless, the aesthetic and originality make for a pleasing experience, and I enjoyed my return to Monument Valley.
I forgot what innovation means and the MM2 reminded me. This is what good game design is. Simple, fun, and drop dead gorgeous.

Too short and the puzzle's too easy. While MV2 is also beautiful and creative, it's not as pretty as the first one. There's also less 'beautiful' sound effects. Then again, it might be because I prefer MV1's pastel colored theme. And probably because there's no enemy-like existence (like the crows), the game become way easier, which makes me a bit disappointed. And idk if it's only me, but I think the optical illusion-ish puzzle has been toned down? I wanted to rate this game 3* at first, but I appreciate the new things on this game (like the growing trees) so I give it 4*. Thanks for your hard work, I'll be waiting for more puzzles.

This game is not worth $5; just because the first game won app of the year doesn't justify the price. The game is too short and too easy. The first game was fun and challenging, but this game doesn't do a good enough job raising the difficulty. There were certain new game mechanics I was excited about, but this was a missed opportunity to challenge the player more. I will say that the design is beautiful and the mother daughter relationship was interesting. But overall I would not recommend this game unless it went on sale.

Short and sweet, beautiful concept and a pleasure to play. Felt easier than the first but I enjoyed it just as much. I imagine ustwo are extremely proud of this.

Only the simple story line difference makes this game a sequel rather than an appendix to the first. It has its own subtle vibe, a mature elegant design with a pop of fantasy and is just as stunning visually and auditorily as the first.  Where I am left wanting, is the lack of depth in the puzzels. They fail to challenge and are so ridiculously repetitive to the original MV game that the illusion has lost its trick. The levels are truly beautiful, but a veneer to the game's overwrought story line. The quick simple play disengages me from the thrall that captivated me in Ida's‚Äã story and I can't fall into the sequel's plot because of it.  Critic that I am, I however still love this sequel because it brings me back to a very happy place in my heart that is reserved for monument valley and for that it deserves praise.  Calm music and beautiful art enchants me into ignoring the unfair expectations I had for this anticipated sequel. So yes spend the money because this is beautiful, RELAXING, and the developers deserves recognition for the work they put into giving us more of a wonderful thing.

This is a very welcome sequel to the first of its name, bringing fresh challenges and a rekindling of interest in this type of puzzle.  As a few have pointed out, there is a bit of a shift in some aspects in regards to comparing the two.  I noticed that, and at first, I was kind of put out, adopting a similar view.   Yet, I think that I had placed expectations to have the same fulfillment of surprise and wonder as had the first game stirred.  The enjoyment is still there, it's just, like now, it's a different time in the story and that is well worth it.

More attention was given to the narrative this time around, although I don't know if that made it much better. The gameplay and graphical style are still top-notch, although this game didn't feel quite as difficult as the first. I would be interested to see what Ustwo Games could do with this game universe on a larger scale (e.g. a several-hour-long console/PC game worth a higher price tag). The low price is appreciated, but I wonder if the corresponding game size is limiting their creativity at this point.

Don't get me wrong, it's a great game and one of the best on the app store, but for the price, it is quite short, only about a half hour of gameplay really. Which is very disappointing. The controls are also a bit awkward at times too when trying to spin certain points.
LOVE this game to bitz and pieces!

A beautifully framed game, with excellent music, graphics and atmosphere, that sadly fails because the puzzles just aren't very challenging. I can be very satisfying when you see how a complex mc echer puzzle fits together, but for the most part you can randomly move the things you can move around and you'll get to where you want to be. Most levels seem very short, and you move from set piece to set piece to really to quickly to really get your head around it. Just as you think the levels is going to open up with an extra layer of complexity, it finishes. The levels lack much a difficulty curve, I'd expect the puzzles in the last few levels to be extremely challanging, time consuming, with many layers of complexity, but instead were no harder than the rest of th game. Especially as I imagine many players would have played MV 1 and the DLC, we could have built up to a much bigger challange after the first few intro levels. Because of this, it lacks the wonder and amazement it could easily have with just a bit more thought in puzzle design, which games like The Room deliver by opening up new possibilities just whrn you think you have everything solved.  Overall, great style, but very little substance. Left my feeling a bit flat once I'd completed, with no replay value.
I loved every second of this game. It has stunning visuals, fantastic music, and it just makes you feel good. I highly recommend it to anyone and everyone.

I loved the first Monument Valley and was so excited to try the 2nd version. Sadly, I was let down by INSANELY easy levels and a short game. The first game had me stuck on levels for a while and in this one it was basically just clicking through without much mental effort. Some levels require no effort and and could be solved by a two year old. I started to time myself on each chapter to see just how ridiculously easy it was and on the last six chapters I took less than 7 minutes on each one. The last level took me 6 minutes, although I have no doubt I could've lowered the time if the animations could be skipped.   Tldr; Really pretty game with levels so easy, you'll get frustrated that you're beating it so fast with no effort.

Disappointingly easy. No level will take you more than 30 seconds. In the first MV the difficulty ramped up better. The new dynamics seemed promising but were barely explored. Over within an hour of game play. Disappointing. Lovely graphics and ideas as per MV 1 but underwhelming.

I loved the first part, and I spent hours of hours of time playing it, alone and with colleagues on work. I revisited it many times, playing the same levels just for fun and stunning visuals. So I bought this one without hesistating a bit. But honestly, I feel a little bit cheated here, and I guess many people who already played the first part feel the same. The game can be finished in one breath, and beside stunning graphics, there is no depth and complexity to these new levels at all. Also, nothing new is brought to the table, except those transforming plants, and this could as well work as another "expansion" set for the first game, as it simply doesn't feel as a new $6.53 game at all. I repeat, I'm writing this as someone who played the first game for months. Maybe the new players will find some complexity and quest here, but in general the game feels much more easier and not as near as demanding as first one. Which is a shame, considering the price tag here. For this price I expected a few more levels of story, and more complexity in gameplay. Something tells me we can expect "expansion" levels in coming months, with their own price tag ofcourse.

When I first played this, I thought maybe I had inflated expectations from the crazy long wait. So I reinstalled MV 1 and the add on chapters and re-played them to be sure. I think more effort was put into Forgotten Shores than all of Monument Valley 2. If this were not a sequel, I might be able to excuse Chapter 1, but it took seeing it three times to believe that really was the entire chapter. The entire first chapter was shorter than an advertisement. Not ok. The flowers that are created at the end of some chapters are whimsical, at best, but a complete waste of time and space otherwise. I wish more effort had been invested in creating something new or more challenging. But in most every way, this entire game was less (in every way) than the first and the add on chapters. The Room series took their games to serious new levels each time. I don't want to compare apples and oranges, but this was truly a disappointment. I recommend that people not waste their money and just re-play the first game with add ons. Maybe the next one will be better?

After playing the first game I was quite excited to see they made a second one and this one did not disappoint!!!!! Great graphics and awesome music (a lot better experience with headphones). I found the first one a bit more challenging though. Highly recommend purchase!!!

To me one of the greatest ‚ô• games ever made along with the original.. The polish and shine both on sound and visuals has taken another step up from the original.. I just find monument 2 and the first sooo captivating..  For the people who complain over the length for 4.99 (they must be young and not understand the work, craftsmanship undertaken and time with a small team, to produce each level). Back in the day this game on a snes or dreamcast would have cost four times the small sum that is currently asked.. I find it hard to award anything full marks, perfection, but this is the closest a game as come.. This and half life orange box (different type of game completely), show what a game is capable of made with pure passion. 4.9 out of five and it only loses 0.1 of a mark because over time they mat add more levels or surpass this truly wonderful game with M Valley 3? I can dream :-) Amazing gameplay, wonderful soundtrack and visuals and intuitive controls.. The leading example of this genre.. An astounding game easily worth the money.. You simply have to appreciate the work gone into this little title!!! One of the greatest games of all time.. Especially on a mobile device!  Update: having read some of the comments, people want a lot for the price of a good coffee and slice of cake. Think of the work involved!!!  do people have no idea, the level of work involved in putting a title like this together?  And thankfully add free!! Yet ea charges up to ¬£80 for some gold coins you can buy one car with, not to mention others who ask u to pay to remove annoying adds or pay to play longer. I'm genuinely at a loss that they think five pounds or dollars is a lot, when a coffee or a magazine is in a similar ball park for cost. I think folk nowadays don't want the moon on a stick alone, they want it sugar coated with a cherry on and sprinkles and then for it to be handed to them free of charge.. but expect to be paid a handsome amount for their efforts of labour in the world of work.  I guess nowadays u can't please people all of the time but please ustwo games, for me you have made the game I waited for and I wait again and hope that monument lives on... Thank u for your hard work and personally it was every penny and then some!!!! Thank u!!!
Excellence

Just like its predecessor, this is a gorgeous, relaxing, enjoyable game. I feel like it's maybe a tad short for the price, but I would definitely buy it again regardless. I'm hoping that, like with the first one, expansions are added to this one as well. There are a few new mechanics to operate in this game (the growing/moving trees are the coolest), and there's more of a story to follow as well (or at least one that's more understandable), so there are definitely some improvements over the first Monument Valley - something I wouldn't have thought possible. The puzzles overall seem a bit simpler, and while a few were too easy, for the most part I appreciated not having to look up any solutions on Youtube. This is definitely a game to download and take the time to enjoy, level by level. Great job, devs!

Monument Valley is here... at last! Strange, that there is not much publicity about the launch of this popular franchise on the Google Play store? I played a few levels so far... It is good, but it's feels more like a brand new expensive DLC than a brand new title. Nevertheless, if you like the first game it is certainly a must buy! I expect that ustwo games will make more levels in future updates to make the game worth its expensive price! In a few words, good but more of the same!
One of very few mobile games that actually deserves 5 stars.

Absolutely fantastic follow-up to it's predecessor which set the bar quite high. I've only just bought the game and will take my time finishing it but just the first few minutes leave you feeling the same way MV 1. Monument Valley is an adventure into geometry and Escher-like level design while maintaining a zen experience for the player. 6/5 highly recommend
